Welcome to EzLaTeX’s documentation!¶

class ezlatex.core.exp(value=None, method=None, displayf=None, latexf=None, evalf=None, **kwargs)¶

LaTeX-able and Callable Expressions.

__add__(other)¶

Return new expression defined as self + other

__call__(*args, **kwargs)¶

Evaluates all the functions recursively, using kwargs as variables if provided. If not all variables are pro- vided, it will evaluate as much as possible into the returned expression.

>>> expr = exp.sin("x") + exp("r") * 3
>>> expr(r=2)
sin(x) + 6.0                # this is an exp
>>> exp(x=math.pi, r=2)
7.0                         # this is a float

If override_value kwarg is provided in the constructor, that number will override the default value (i.e. a display as \infty, but a value of 99).

If override_name kwarg is provided in the constructor, that name will be used to match the variable in this method’s **kwargs.

If evalf is not provided in the constructor, this will throw a NotImplementedError.

Parameters

  • *args – none expected

  • **kwargs – variables to be computed with

Returns

float if all variables given, else exp

Return type

float or exp

__eq__(other)¶

Return new expression defined as self = other

__ge__(other)¶

Return new expression defined as self \geq other

__gt__(other)¶

Return new expression defined as self > other

__init__(value=None, method=None, displayf=None, latexf=None, evalf=None, **kwargs)¶

Initializes an expression.

Parameters

  • value –

    any of the arguments normally passed to this method

    • if type is ezlatex.exp then this object acts as parenthesis

    • if type is str then this object is a variable

    • if type is a number then this object is a number

    • if type is a tuple then a method should be passed to evaluate/display

    • if value is None then this object is a new variable x_n, where n keeps increasing as we make more

  • method (str) – method name (i.e. "sum")

  • displayf (func) – simple display function

  • latexf (func) – latex display function

  • evalf (func) – evaluation function

Keyword Arguments

  • override_name (str) – override name to be referred to in __call__’s kwargs; also overrides default name creating (i.e. delta -> delta)

  • override_value – override constant value to be used in __call__ (useful for values like infinity, which can be computed as a large real number)

__le__(other)¶

Return new expression defined as self \leq other

__lt__(other)¶

Return new expression defined as self < other

__mul__(other)¶

Return new expression defined as self * other

__ne__(other)¶

Return new expression defined as self \neq other

__neg__()¶

Return new expression defined as -self

__pow__(power, modulo=None)¶

Return new expression defined as self ^ other

__repr__()¶

Represent an expression. If exp._mode is: * 0, then this will be a basic representation: a stringified number, variable name, or string of the format [method](first_input, second_input, ….). * 1, then this will be a display representation: it will return displayf if it exists, otherwise the same as the basic representation * 2, then this will be a LaTeX representation: it will return latexf if it exists, otherwise the same as the display representation

__sub__(other)¶

Return new expression defined as self - other

__truediv__(other)¶

Return new expression defined as self / other. Displays a fraction in LaTeX.

to_latex(display_style=True)¶

Convert to LaTeX.

ezlatex.core.expression(f)¶

Wrapper for functions to use that converts all inputs into expressions, with special features:

>>> @expression
>>> def f(a, b, c):
>>>    return a**2 + 45 * b / c
>>> f()  # this is an expression
a^2 + 45b / c
>>> f(1, -5, 6)  # this is a float
-29.0
>>> f(a=1, b=2)  # this is an expression
1 + 90 / c
ezlatex.core.simple(f)¶

Wrapper for simple functions that require all inputs to be computed before the function can proceed.

ezlatex.core.to_exp(items)¶

Converts items to exp. If items is a list, then each item will be converted; if otherwise, items itself will be.

Parameters

items – A str, int, float, list, tuple or exp to be converted to an exp

Returns

converted items

Return type

exp
